headline: Harden Your Systems: Today's Focus Areas

digest_items.title: Verify API versioning strategy
digest_items.why: Deprecated API versions may have unpatched vulnerabilities
digest_items.fix: Maintain clear deprecation timeline and force upgrades for old versions

digest_items.title: Use Web Application Firewall (WAF)
digest_items.why: WAF protects against common web attacks like SQL injection and XSS
digest_items.fix: Deploy CloudFlare, AWS WAF, or ModSecurity

digest_items.title: Review user access permissions
digest_items.why: Stale permissions from former employees pose security risk
digest_items.fix: Conduct quarterly access reviews and remove unnecessary permissions

digest_items.title: Enable database encryption at rest
digest_items.why: Unencrypted databases are vulnerable if storage media is compromised
digest_items.fix: Enable Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) or equivalent for your database

digest_items.title: Enable DNSSEC for your domain
digest_items.why: DNSSEC prevents DNS spoofing attacks by cryptographically signing DNS records
digest_items.fix: Contact your DNS provider to enable DNSSEC and add DS records to your registrar

digest_items.title: Verify patch management process
digest_items.why: Unpatched systems are vulnerable to known exploits
digest_items.fix: Establish regular patching schedule and test updates before deployment

digest_items.title: Scan for exposed secrets in repos
digest_items.why: Committed secrets can be found by attackers scanning public repositories
digest_items.fix: Use tools like git-secrets or truffleHog to scan commit history
